page.title: 01BADCALL NEAR SCOURIE
page.content: This area has a short coastline with some islands. The main road in n.w. Scotland passes through the area. The Eddrachills Hotel is situated beside the road. The hotel provides full time work for 3 people in the winter and 6 in summer. Hotel visitors mostly come for the fishing. The mobile library visits the hotel once a fortnight. Salmon fish cages are located on the coast and the nets are hung on tall poles to dry and repair. The landscape is predominantly wet and boggy with many inland lakes. There were some sheep and a derelict farm on the coast apart from the hotel there are no other houses. There is a nature reserve surrounding a lake near the coastline: unusually for this area, the reserve has deciduous trees. The old single track road has been replaced by a new 2 track road inland
